intro: Koanophyllon montanum, commonly known as the mountain knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Koanophyllon montanum plays a role in stabilizing soil in alpine areas and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
